Title: Perfect Day for a Nervous Date
SubTitle: No Translation

Text:
One day after school, a girl caught the presence of a
boy in the classroom and eagerly dashed towards him.
That girl was Sherry.

To that end, I was thinking about going shopping in
the open air market on my next day off.
Oh? That's nice.

So you see! I want you to accompany me, Cid, so
I've come here to ask you along!
Why me?
Because of something Father told me.

There are some pretty dangerous areas in the open-air
market, he said, so I mustn't go there alone. He told me
I should ask you to come along.
He mentioned my name?
Yes!

Well, as a devout NPC, I can't possibly turn down
a direct order from the assistant principal.

In fact, if I did say no, things would take an
awkward turn. If you can't beat 'em, join 'em,
I guess.
Cid? What are you mumbling to yourself about?
Oh, it's nothing. Understood. I'll go with you.

You mean it?! Oh, I was so worried that you'd turn me
down!
Okay, here's where and when we'll meet up...

Heehee! It sure is fun making plans to go out with
a friend, isn't it!

Oh! If there's any place you'd like to go, Cid,
please speak up. I would feel bad dragging
you around to only the places I want to go.

Hmm...I don't think there's any place in particular
I'd like to go. So don't worry about me.

Are you sure?! O-Okay, then, I'll roll up my sleeves
and plan away!

Ah...take it easy, okay? One day is too short to get
through any grand plan you conjure up.
Y-Yes, you're right! I'll take it easy!

Time passes by in a flash, and the long-awaited day
has arrived at last.
Um, Cid? Is there something strange about my outfit?
Huh? Why do you ask?

Well, you've been staring at me a lot ever since you
got here...and it's making me feel self-conscious.

Sorry. I'm just used to seeing you in your uniform,
I guess, so it's a refreshing change.
Yeah, I think I like that style on you. It suits you.
Mmf! W-Well...th-thank you.

(Cid complimented my style?! I've never experienced
anyone complimenting my choice of fashion before...
I had no idea it was such a happy feeling.)

So where're we going? You didn't tell me anything
about it.

Oh yes, that's right... Well, first, let's go in that
shop!
What do they sell?

Ribbons and hair accessories. Each and every item in
there is so cute.
Oh, that's interesting.
Let's go, Cid!
Oh, Cid, do you think this ribbon is cute?
Yeah, I think it's nice.

And I think this one is simple enough that it will go
well with my school uniform.
Yeah, I think it will.

And if I wish to express my personality, then this
ribbon...
Yeah, I think it matches your vibe.

Hearing that everything suits her makes Sherry
confused... She can't decide what to buy.

Why, yes, it does! Heehee, well, since you like them
all, I'll just buy them all!

Since she can't make a decision, she decides not
to choose. Luckily, she has saved up more than
enough money for the outing.
What's your budget?
Don't worryI don't have a budget!
Ah. I see how it is.

I'm going to go pay for these now!
Wait just a minute!

(Heehee, I'm shopping with a friend on my day off...
I've always dreamed of doing this. It's so much fun!)

After leaving the hair accessory store, they head
towards some stalls along the side of the street.
The town has an air of vitality about it.
Hmm... Would this statuette look strange in my room?
A golden pig? Well, everybody has different tastes.

Each of their faces...looks a bit different. Which
one do you think is best?
Hm? Umm...this one?
Hehe, okay then, I'll take this one!
You really like it that much?
Um...yes?

I'm surprised you're hugging it right after you
bought it. It's not really that valuable, to be
honest.

But you chose it for me, Cid. So it's valuable to me.
Who cares about the price!
I see...

Oh! We're running behind schedule! I'm sorry. I was
stressing out too much...

It's okay if we go off schedule. In fact, it's more
fun that way.
Is that...how it works?

Yes, that's how it works. For starters...I'm a little
hungry. Wanna grab lunch? Or is that too off-
schedule for you?

It is a bit early, but... Heehee! I don't mind if we
go a little off-schedule!
Okay, it's decided, then. Let's find a restaurant.
They follow their noses through the market until...
Huh?
What's wrong?

C-Can I stop for a minute...and j-just have a little
look at these products?!
Sure.

(This is an antique store. It must have so many
unusual items. I'll have to look a little closer to
find out how valuable any of them are...)
What...?!
What's up? Found something you like?
Is this...what I think it is...?
Yeah. It sure looks like it.
Oh...! Yes, I knew it!

Unless they are mistaken, the item Sherry is holding
is something that should not be for sale at an open-
air market.

I'll j-just go ask for the price. Excuse me, shop
keeper!
Cid, would you mind waiting a minute?

Huh? Judging by the way you're acting...are you about
to haggle for it?
...Yes.

Then shouldn't you buy it as is? Didn't you just say
you don't have a budget?

My budget isn't the issue here. It's the brooch...
Didn't you see it?
It just looked like an ordinary old brooch to me.

Well...it might be an artifact. I saw a photograph of
it in an auction catalogue a while ago.
That old thing?

It was mixed in with all the other antiquesonly
an artifact expert would be able to distinguish it
at a glance.

It's well-documented that that brooch was sold once
by a millionaire at an auction.
So what's it doing here?

Well... Word has it that its buyer died, and after a
messy inheritance dispute, it was lost.

And years later, its true value still unknown, it
winds up for sale in a cheap antiques shop in
an open air market...
Why are you so knowledgeable about it?
Huh? Well, that's because...

The artifact in question is actually said to give
its wearer the power to allure the opposite sex.

And ever since meeting Cid, Sherry's interest tends
to fall on artifacts of thit type.

(I want to become closer with Cid...but I'm way too
embarrassed to say so.)

B-Because I'm a specialist, of course! I study this
sort of thing every day!
Now it all makes sense.

Naturally, artifacts with powerful effects are quite
valuable. They are not the sort of thing a girl can
buy with her allowance.
Or so you might think...
I'm going to go buy it...
You don't need to whisper.

No, if anyone else finds out how valuable that item
is, there will be a bidding war.
You think it'll come to that?
I'm...going to discreetly buy it, okay?
Okay. Well, good luck.

(It looks like any old broach. Who would guess it's
an artifact that attracts the opposite sex?)

(What a relief... Nobody seemed to realize this was
an artifactincluding the shop keeperso now I
can study it a little...)

(If it appears to be too potent, I'll have to give it
to the kingdom to manage.)
Looks like you bought what you wanted.
Oh! Y-Yes!
Aren't you gonna put it on?

I...want to study it a bit first. I'm still unclear
as to what effect it has.
I get it. Too bad. I thought it'd suit you.
It would suit...me? You mean me?

(This artifact has the power to attract the opposite
sex... If I were to use it on Cid...then maybe we
could become even closer than we already are.)

She frantically shakes the thought out of her head
the instant it appears.

(What are you even thinking, Sherry? You can't use
an artifact to win over Cid's heart... That's just
wrong!)

It's gotten crowded. I guess it's because it's
lunchtime.

By the way, if that's an artifact, that means it has
some sort of power, right?

Oh! Um, yes. It has the power to...er, no! That is...
I still don't really know.
Caught off guard, Sherry has to lie to Cid.

(But...it's okay, right? I'm probably going to hand
over this artifact to the kingdom anyway...)
She suddenly bumps into something in the crowd.
Eek?!
The impact makes her drop the artifact to the ground.
And the next moment...
Huh...?
W-Whaaat?! It b-broke?!
It broke?

Sherry scrambles over to the brooch to find that its
red stone has fallen off and is rolling on the ground.
Ah.

Oh, Cid...wh-what shall I do?! The artifact...
I've broken the artifact.

She shakes frantically, unsure of what to do for a
moment.
Hey. Read this.
Huh?
The spot where the stone was joined to the base.
Let me see... rep...repli...replica?!
Oh-whoa-whoa! B-But it can't be!

Well, if it were a real artifact, I don't think it
would've broken like that.
But isn't this a good thing?
A...good thing?
For a moment, she doesn't understand what Cid means.

If it's not an artifact, that means you can wear it
without worrying about any effects.
You can just glue the stone back on.
Oh...right. Yes, you're right!
I think you'll look great in it, Sherry.
Huh? I'll...look great?

(Cid complimented me yet again... He said I would
look great in this brooch!)

(Heehee! Cid complimented me so many times today...
Even though it's a replica...I guess it still works.)
Just try to watch where you're going from now on.
Huh?

It's probably the lunch rush... That's why there's so
many people out. Try not to lose me, okay?
O-Okay...
We need to eat lunch, too. I'm so hungry...

Oh! That restaurant we just passed that smelled
good... Isn't that it over there? Let's go check it
out.

Sherry gazes at Cid's back as he starts to walk ahead...
She tries mustering up the courage to ask him something.

(I don't need to rely on an artifact for help...
I'm already enough!)

Um, Cid! If you don't want me to lose you in the
crowd...can we hold hands?
Hold hands? Sure, why not.

His response makes Sherry's calm mood vanish in a
flash. She carefully tucks the broken brooch away,
takes Cid's hand, and starts to walk...

And her gait is the most cheerful it has been all
day.
